name: Saltwater Crocodile
facts: Saltwater crocs are the largest reptiles on Earth, growing up to 7 meters long!
They can hold their breath for over an hour underwater.
Their bite is the strongest of any animal alive today.

speechPractice.tip: Start with the back of your tongue touching the roof of your mouth for the K sound!

name: Great White Shark
facts: Great white sharks can smell a single drop of blood from 5 kilometers away!
They have about 300 teeth arranged in several rows.
Despite their scary reputation, they're actually curious creatures.

speechPractice.tip: The K sound at the end is quick and sharp - like a snap!

name: Eastern Brown Snake
facts: The eastern brown snake is responsible for more deaths in Australia than any other snake.
They can move incredibly fast when threatened.
Baby brown snakes are just as venomous as adults!

name: Sydney Funnel-web Spider
facts: The funnel-web is one of the most venomous spiders in the world!
They build funnel-shaped webs in cool, moist places.
An antivenom was developed in 1981 and has saved many lives.

name: Box Jellyfish
facts: Box jellyfish have 24 eyes but no brain!
Their tentacles can be up to 3 meters long.
They are almost completely see-through, making them hard to spot.

name: Blue-ringed Octopus
facts: Despite being the size of a golf ball, it has enough venom to kill 26 adults!
When threatened, its blue rings glow bright as a warning.
They are actually quite shy and only bite when handled.

speechPractice.tip: Feel the K sound pop in the middle of oc-to-pus!

name: Red Kangaroo
facts: Red kangaroos can jump up to 9 meters in a single bound!
A group of kangaroos is called a mob.
Their powerful legs can deliver kicks strong enough to break bones.

speechPractice.tip: Feel the G sound rumble in your throat - KANG-ga-roo!

name: Southern Cassowary
facts: Cassowaries have a dagger-like claw that can be 12cm long!
They can run up to 50 km/h through dense rainforest.
The colorful skin on their neck can change color based on mood.

speechPractice.tip: Start strong with a crisp K sound at the beginning!

name: Platypus
facts: Male platypuses have venomous spurs on their back legs!
They use their bill to detect electrical signals from prey.
They are one of only five mammals that lay eggs.

name: Dingo
facts: Dingoes are Australia's largest land predator!
They don't bark like domestic dogs - they howl and yodel.
Dingoes have been in Australia for over 4,000 years.

speechPractice.tip: The G comes twice! DING-go - feel it vibrate!

name: Muttaburrasaurus
facts: Muttaburrasaurus was named after the town of Muttaburra in Queensland!
It had a distinctive bump on its snout that may have been used to make sounds.
This plant-eater roamed Australia about 100 million years ago.

name: Australovenator
facts: Australovenator was nicknamed 'Banjo' after the famous Australian poet!
It was one of the top predators in Australia 95 million years ago.
Its name means 'Southern Hunter' - and it was a fierce one!

name: Diamantinasaurus
facts: Diamantinasaurus was a gentle giant that ate plants!
It could grow up to 16 meters long - as long as 3 cars!
Named after the Diamantina River in Queensland where it was found.

name: Kunbarrasaurus
facts: Kunbarrasaurus was covered in bony armor for protection!
It had a complex inner ear, suggesting excellent hearing.
This tank-like dinosaur was about the size of a large sheep.

speechPractice.tip: Start with a strong K - KUN-bar-ra-saurus!

name: Leaellynasaura
facts: Leaellynasaura had huge eyes to see in the dark polar winters!
It was named after Leaellyn Rich, daughter of the scientists who found it.
This small dinosaur lived in Antarctica when it was connected to Australia!

name: Kronosaurus
facts: Kronosaurus was one of the largest marine reptiles ever at 10 meters long!
Its head alone was 2.4 meters - longer than most humans are tall!
Named after Kronos, the Greek god who ate his own children!

speechPractice.tip: The KR blend is tricky! Push air out hard for KROH-no-saurus!

name: Minmi
facts: Minmi was the first armored dinosaur discovered in the Southern Hemisphere!
It was named after Minmi Crossing in Queensland.
Despite being armored, Minmi was only about 3 meters long.

name: Ozraptor
facts: Ozraptor means 'Australian thief' - it was a speedy hunter!
It's one of the oldest known dinosaurs from Australia.
Only a small piece of leg bone has ever been found.

name: Qantassaurus
facts: Qantassaurus was named after Qantas, the Australian airline!
It was a small, fast-running plant-eater about 2 meters long.
This dinosaur lived during the Early Cretaceous period.

speechPractice.tip: The QU makes a KW sound - KWON-ta-saurus!

name: Woolungasaurus
facts: Woolungasaurus swam in the shallow seas that once covered inland Australia!
It had a very long neck to catch fish and squid.
Named from an Aboriginal word meaning 'long water creature'.

speechPractice.tip: Feel the G vibrate in LUNG-ga! It's a voiced sound!
